meanings.definition: A person who creates or maintains a catalog.
meanings.sent1: The catalogers organized all the books in the library.
meanings.sent2: The catalogers updated the online catalog with new items.
meanings.sent3: The catalogers joked that organizing books was like solving a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: She was a cataloger of memories, neatly arranging each one in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The diligent catalogers meticulously sorted through the inventory.

meanings.definition: The act of creating or maintaining a catalog.
meanings.sent1: Catalogers spend hours inputting data into the system.
meanings.sent2: The library's catalogers ensure that all items are properly listed.
meanings.sent3: The catalogers' dedication to their work was truly admirable.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a cataloger, neatly categorizing every detail.
meanings.sent5: The precision of the catalogers' work was evident in the organized shelves.
